data.title: downtown lunch spot
data.text: downtown lunch spot, few blocks from james center area.  fairly small maybe 15 tables inside. service was very friendly.  food was pretty good, but maybe a little bit on the pricey side.

data.title: Delicious, fast and friendly
data.text: We had a quick lunch in this pleasant deli. Food was excellent. Try the cornedbeef sandwich and the salads. Service is fast and friendly.

data.title: Alot of Money for a Little Bit of Food!!!!
data.text:
I stopped in at The Wall Street Deli there for a quick lunch a few months. I ordered the Chili and grilled cheese sandwich special to go for about $9.00 including tax (which is a good deal or so i thought)...There was only one person ahead of me in-line and approximately 4 customers in the whole restaurant....There were two cooks in the back, the owner and a really nice and friendly 
waitress...so they weren't busy..I waited twenty minutes for my
order...when it finally arrived the chili was luke warm and placed in a skimpy styrofoam cup (approx. 4 oz). The grilled cheese sandwich looked about 4 inches by 4 inches(if that)...I said something to the owner about the portion size. He seemed to get irritated and gave me an excuse "it's the biggest cup we have"....Oh well...it's not the first time i've been ripped off at this place. About 10 years ago, i ordered a medium size sub and a piece of cake..It came to over $14.00....I thought i would give them another chance but it didn't change in ten years....So i finally learned my lesson...I will never go back to this place again.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: I work very near Wall Street Deli and they have very good food and you won't go away hungry. It's in the heart of downtown at the corner of 8th and Franklin. Their salads and sandwiches are great. It gets busy but it's worth the wait.

data.title: Decent little lunch spot
data.text: Good food, reasonable prices, nice staff, and quick service.

data.title: Hidden gem!
data.text: Walked around the downtown area with my 17-years old son, who is a fan of any local eateries, as he finds it important to support small businesses - i agree! Subway is just across the street, but we decided to give Wall Street Deli a chance, although I did not remember seeing any reviews of it on the trustful tripadvisor - I'm glad we did! Nice and friendly middle-aged stuff (kudos to them!), delicious cheesburgers, clean, calm, perfect!!!

data.title: A good lunch option downtown. Nothing fancy but very city.
data.text: A good lunch option downtown. Nothing fancy but very city.
